CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2021
CommentsContent: I like this little unit...well it's not really little but it does do a good job! I've air fried a number of things in it including wings, drumsticks, prefrozen packaged food and appetizers, french fries, and even hot dogs. They have all come out great!I do recommend that when air frying, you open it up every five minutes and toss/shake the food around quickly. It allows the air to circulate to all parts of your food. You get a better overall "fry" when you do this.It is also relatively easy to clean after use. I usually rinse out any residual oil and then take the main container with perforated food container and fill with water and dishwashing soap. I scrub out both....they are non-stick coated so it's pretty easy. After rinsing, I just shove the unit back into the main housing and turn the heat to about 300 for about 5 minutes to dry it out and it's good to go whenever you need it!As you can see from the pictures, there are recommendations for fryer temps and cooking times. I use the temps recommended but I have found that cooking times are usually a bit longer than is indicated. So just don't blindly follow the information printed on the top....it is only a recommendation. Cooking times will vary depending on the amount of food you place in the unit to cook as well as if you shake/toss the food every five minutes or so. Other than that, this is a great little unit. Everything is analog to all you have is a dial for temp and time. There are no LEDs or special programming functions....just turn it on and it works! I recommend it for anyone that wants a simple air fryer and doesn't have need for a bunch of bells and whistles.
